trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_00<tab>Erenville looks upon Yyasulani in disbelief.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_01<tab>You and the others struggle to make sense of what you see as you take in the dreary surroundings. Idle speculation will lead nowhere, however, and so you press on in search of clues that might explain what has befallen Erenville's home.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_02<tab>Surveying the area, you spy what looks like a train station in the distance. Surmising it to be Yyasulani Station, you head in that direction, hoping to find passengers from the train nearby.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_03<tab>Though you know for a fact that the train passed through here quite recently, the station appears to have not been used in decades. Wuk Lamat suggests having a look around for anything that might help make sense of the situation.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_04<tab>A closer examination of the buildings and train tracks lends further support to the possibility that the train station has been unattended for many long years. Perhaps Wuk Lamat has fared better in discovering anything of note.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_05<tab>Wuk Lamat calls the group's attention to a broken sentry similar to the soldiers that attacked Tuliyollal. While this all but confirms that Zoraal Ja holds control over the area, it fails to explain what has happened to Yyasulani. Its ruinous state suggests time has somehow leapt forward, but you have yet to find anything that might explain such a phenomenon. To be absolutely certain of where you are, Wuk Lamat asks Erenville to take you all to his home, and so the group sets off. All except G'raha Tia, whose attention is drawn to peculiar structures nearby.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_06<tab>G'raha Tia could not help but notice pole-shaped structures in the distance that appear to function as lightning rods. He moves in for a closer look, and you follow after him.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_07<tab>Upon closer inspection, G'raha Tia surmises the beacon-like structures are used to harness lightning as a source of energy─though it remains to be seen what that energy is used for. His curiosity sated, the two of you go and rejoin the others.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_08<tab>Erenville's home is in ruins, the village seemingly abandoned. A sullen silence falls over the group, which is immediately broken by the appearance of a stranger in even stranger garb. She welcomes you to what she calls Alexandria and introduces herself as Sphene, the Queen of Reason. Zoraal Ja rules alongside her as king, but she claims the two are at odds. In fact, she begs your aid in stopping him.
Talking with Sphene further, you reach the conclusion that two worlds have somehow become one within the confines of the dome, though the catalyst for this phenomenon is not immediately clear. Hoping to show you more of Alexandria, and perhaps shed more light on how this joining occurred, she invites you to a place she calls the outskirts.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SEQ_09<tab>Sphene is all smiles as she leads the group to the outskirts, but Alisaie believes that there is more to the queen than meets the eye. Only time will tell if she is truly friend or foe.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Alisaie.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_02<tab>Gather information at Yyasulani Station.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_04<tab>Speak with G'raha Tia.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_05<tab>Speak with G'raha Tia again.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_06<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_TODO_07<tab>Speak with Alisaie.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_KRILE_000_001<tab>This is Yyasulani...?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_005<tab>There was no sensation of passing into a different world. This couldn't be a reflection...could it?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_010<tab>I don't know what I was expecting, but it wasn't this.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_015<tab>Things keep getting stranger and stranger...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_020<tab>It doesn't make sense...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_021<tab>That tower─was it always there?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_022<tab>No, definitely not. Nor the wall over there.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_023<tab>The material's not something we use in Tural. It's closer to what we saw at the gate to the golden city, or those mechanical soldiers.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_KRILE_000_024<tab>Such a massive structure couldn't possibly have been built in so short a time.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_025<tab>Then I'm inclined to assume we've been transported to another location. Or perhaps...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_026<tab>Well, speculation will avail us naught. We need to learn more before we can draw conclusions.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_027<tab>Let's take a look around, then.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_KRILE_000_030<tab>This place is isolated by the dome, yet the skies are heavy with thunderclouds. The air oversaturated with lightning-aspected aether...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_035<tab>I recognize the lay of the land. It's definitely Yyasulani. And yet...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_040<tab>Haven't seen anyone so far...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_045<tab>This place is unnatural in a way I've never seen before.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_050<tab>That looks like a train station, doesn't it?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_051<tab>That must be Yyasulani Station, where the passengers disembarked!
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_052<tab>Then perhaps we'll find someone to talk to there. Let's go and investigate.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_KRILE_000_055<tab>This aetheryte is of Turali design.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_060<tab>It's fallen into total disrepair. Almost as if it hasn't been used in decades...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_065<tab>Amidst enormous alien structures, we have more familiar sights like this station...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_070<tab>This is a water tower for trains, isn't it?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_080<tab>Hmm. I'm pretty sure this is Yyasulani Station...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_081<tab>But from the state of it, I'd swear it was abandoned years ago.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_082<tab>I'm not sure what to make of this. We should look around a bit more.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_085<tab>I think this thing is broken.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SYSTEM_000_090<tab>You find a train turntable. The thick layers of rust suggest it hasn't been used in years.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SYSTEM_000_091<tab>The tracks are heavily rusted. It would seem they haven't been tended to for a long while.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_SYSTEM_000_092<tab>The building is a rotting husk. It has clearly been many years since anyone lived here.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_100<tab>Finished poking around, have you? Let's gather everyone, then. I want you all to take a look at this.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_101<tab>It's one of the mechanical soldiers. Long since broken, apparently.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_102<tab>But I'd say its presence confirms this is indeed Zoraal Ja's domain we're in.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_103<tab>What about the rest of you? Did you learn anything?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_KRILE_000_104<tab>So all evidence suggests this is Yyasulani Station...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_105<tab>Aye, and I've no doubt we're in Yyasulani. But I don't understand why these buildings are so run-down.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_106<tab>They were completed barely a year ago.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_107<tab>For new structures to deteriorate and enormous ones to appear in a flash... If I didn't know better, I'd say time flows differently here.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_100_107<tab>Is such a thing even possible?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_108<tab>We have encountered this phenomenon before, as it so happens.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_100_108<tab>Though it may be difficult to believe, our world is but one of several. In some respects they are similar to one another, but in others wholly different. We call them reflections.

TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_109<tab>Simply put, the rift between dimensions causes time to flow at a different pace in each world. While hours pass in one, years may have come and gone in another.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_KRILE_000_110<tab>But if this is Yyasulani, then we should still be in the Source. The flow of time should be synchronized.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_111<tab>I'm not sure I follow all this talk of reflections and dimensions...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_100_111<tab>But if Erenville says this is Yyasulani, then it must be.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_112<tab>Your village is a little further along, right?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_113<tab>Erenville!
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_114<tab>Oh, uh...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_115<tab>Y-Yes. It's a short distance to the northwest.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_116<tab>Let's head there next, then. Rather than talk theory, it's always better to confirm things firsthand.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_MECHANICALDOLL4927_000_117<tab>(-???-)<bzzzt> May I...be of assistance?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_118<tab>I-It's still functioning!?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_119<tab>It doesn't seem to be hostile, at least. Perhaps we can ask it some questions.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_120<tab>Can you tell us where we are?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_MECHANICALDOLL4927_000_121<tab>(-Defective Automaton-)Unable to confirm credentials. <bzzzt> Please present citizen identification.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_MECHANICALDOLL4927_000_122<tab>(-Defective Automaton-)Unable to confirm credentials. <bzzzt> Confirm. <bzzzt> Confirm. <bzzzt>
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_123<tab>Seems it's broken after all...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_124<tab>T-Too strange by half... Let's leave it be and get going.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_124<tab>Are those lightning rods?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_125<tab>Would you accompany me for a moment? There's something I wish to investigate.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_130<tab>Look there. The lightning appears to be drawn to those pole-shaped structures over yonder.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_131<tab>The design suggests they're some manner of lightning rod.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_132<tab>Let's go and take a closer look.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_140<tab>This material appears to be the same as that used in the mechanical soldiers and warships.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_141<tab>On closer inspection, it appears to bear fine etchings... Rather reminiscent of arcane runes, these. I suspect they're not merely decorative.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_142<tab>I would posit it's used to harness lightning as a source of energy. Quite impressive technology.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_143<tab>I'll share this observation with Y'shtola. For a blessing, the dome doesn't appear to interfere with linkpearls.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_144<tab>Thanks for accompanying me. Let's head to the village and find the others.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ERENVILLE_000_145<tab>What in the world...?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_KRILE_000_150<tab>This is Erenville's village...?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_WUKLAMAT_000_155<tab>Oh, Erenville...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_160<tab>Let's stay vigilant.
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_GRAHATIA_000_165<tab>No sign of anyone...
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_170<tab>I think it goes without saying, but we're not going to trust her just like that, right?
TEXT_KINGMD116_04927_ALISAIE_000_171<tab>Any way you look at it, a mysterious girl who appears out of nowhere, proclaiming herself a queen is suspicious...
